reviews.review_msg: Greg is great. He likes his students and wants them to do well, and has a gift for making the complicated (esp. theory) understandable. He's also very openminded; if it relates, he'll go wherever you want to take things. That said, he's a theorist and a philosopher. His classes are not for the academically fainthearted. He's also prone to tangents.

I have taken several classes with Greg. He is very knowledgeable and his lectures are extremely engaging. He keeps the class alive with jokes and personal experiences. He is also very approachable and always eager to help all his students.
